name: Wazuh Alert Triage — Jira Ticket Creator

parameters.text:
=Analyze the following batch of Wazuh security alerts. For EACH alert, determine if it is a TRUE POSITIVE or FALSE POSITIVE.

Alert Batch ({{ $json.alert_count }} alerts):
```json
{{ JSON.stringify($json.alerts, null, 2) }}
```

For each alert:
1. Review the rule description, severity level, source/destination IPs, and log data
2. Use the SSH tool to connect to the affected server (agent IP: use the agent_ip field) and verify the alert
3. Use the Wazuh API tool to get more context about the agent and recent alerts
4. Classify each alert and provide your findings

Respond with a valid JSON array. Each element must have these exact fields:
{"rule_id": "string", "alert_description": "string", "severity": number, "agent_name": "string", "agent_ip": "string", "classification": "TRUE_POSITIVE" or "FALSE_POSITIVE", "confidence": number, "evidence": "string", "solution": "string", "commands_run": ["array"]}

options.systemMessage: You are a senior security analyst. Analyze Wazuh SIEM alerts and classify them as TRUE_POSITIVE or FALSE_POSITIVE. Use SSH to verify alerts on target servers and the Wazuh API for additional context. Be thorough but concise. Always respond with valid JSON.

parameters.description: Query the Wazuh SIEM API. Send the API endpoint path as input (e.g. /agents, /agents/001, /vulnerability/001). Auth token is included automatically.

Execute a read-only command on a Wazuh agent via SSH. Send JSON: {"host":"IP","command":"cmd"}. Valid hosts: 192.168.1.185 (pve), 192.168.1.186 (n8nsrv), 192.168.1.188 (aisrv), 192.168.1.190 (devsrv), 192.168.1.191 (prodsrv). Only read-only commands allowed.
